question.text: Which of the following is incorrect regarding oxidative phosphorylation?

options.text: Oxidation of 1 molecule of <math><mtext>NADH</mtext></math> gives 3 molecules of <math><mtext>ATP</mtext></math>.
The role of oxygen is limited to the terminal stage of the process.
Oxygen acts as the final hydrogen acceptor.
Cytochrome c is located towards the inner side (matrix) of the inner mitochondrial membrane.

solution.text: <math><mtext>1 NADH</mtext></math> is equivalent to <math><mtext>3 ATPs</mtext></math>. Oxygen is the terminal electron or proton acceptor in <math><mtext>ETC</mtext></math>. Cytochrome c is located towards IMS, i.e., on the outer side of the inner membrane of the mitochondria.
